Articles.Content:
May 21st, 2013

Fellow KerbalsÃ¢â‚¬â€

I am happy to announce that after much idling in orbit around the society, I have begun my descent and am now announcing that I have successfully landed on Kerbin to meet my compatriots in space exploration. I'm been playing KSP for about two months now, and I'm consistently overjoyed with every aspect of the game and the community that surrounds it. I'm really interested in the math that goes into each launch, and will spend most of my time in the threads dedicated to this and similar subject. I hope I can be a positive influence on the community, and look forward to my many interactions with you all.

Kindest regards,

Caramel Sikes

Welcome to the forums!

I've had a great time myself, both with the game itself and as a member of the greater KSP community. It really is one of the nicer, friendlier, and better-moderated boards on the Internet, all things considered. We're glad you chose us as your port of call.

If you have any questions about certain aspects of the game, or if you just want to sharpen your skills, definitely check out some of the resources on the Drawing Board (link in my sig). I've tried my best to gather quality tutorials and reference materials all into one convenient point of access for the benefit of players of all skill levels. The folks in the How To section will be more than willing to answer any questions you may have about the game as well. Finally, don't be afraid to just jump into a conversation if the topic interests you.

Happy landings!
